alert.note: Alert for Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 25 at 6:59PM CDT until August 25 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN SMITH...PHILLIPS...WESTERN FRANKLIN...SOUTHEASTERN FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 658 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stamford to near Alma to 7 miles north of Phillipsburg, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. In addition, a mesonet station 3 miles west-southwest of Woodruff Kansas measured a 64 MPH wind gust at 649 PM CDT. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Alma and Orleans around 705 PM CDT. Republican City, Huntley, and Harlan County Dam around 710 PM CDT. Naponee around 715 PM CDT. Bloomington and Ragan around 725 PM CDT. Franklin around 735 PM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
